isis.stitle: TSI 98-12-14 - Cummins N-14 Engine with Poly-V Fan Belt Run Off

subjectgroup.subject: Cummins N-14 Engine with Poly-V Fan Belt Run Off

geninfo.para: This TSI applies to 91/92/93/9400 models built after July, 1996 with Cummins N-14 engine and Poly-V fan belt.

91/92/93/9400 Models with Cummins N-14 engines built after July, 1996, may experience fan belt run off. To remedy the belt run off condition, a service procedure has been developed to review the fan drive effects and guidelines for proper belt tensioning.

step1.para: Identify the accessory drive pulley part number located on the front face of the pulley.

step2.para: If the accessory drive pulley is part number 3501255 C1, continue with Step 2.
If the accessory drive pulley is part number 3501255 C2, continue with Step 3.

step1.para: Install spacer washers behind the pulley as directed in Authorized Field Change G-97902.
Locate and identify the fan clutch assembly mounting bracket.

step2.para: The new style mounting bracket is painted grey and is on vehicles built after January 1, 1998. The new style bracket will also have a hole in the lower right (passenger side) mounting location and a slightly elongated hole in the lower left (drivers side) mounting location. If the new style bracket is identified continue to Step 6.

The old style mounting bracket is painted blue and is on vehicles built prior to January 1, 1998. The old style bracket must be replaced with Navistar part number 3509699C1 (Horton part number 994153). Continue with Step 4.

step1.para: Install the new style mounting bracket part number 3509699C1 with 2 upper and 2 lower mounting bolts finger tight.

note.para: The 2 lower mounting bolts must be flange head style. Use Navistar part number 414052C1 (1/2 x 20 UNF x 1-1/2 flange head) and part number 25710R1 hardened washer.

step1.para: Tighten the 2 lower bolts to 110 to 120 ft-lbs. (149 to 169 Nm) . Next tighten the 2 upper bolts to 55 to 60 ft-lbs. (74 to 81 Nm).
Visually inspect both the accessory drive pulley and the fan clutch pulley to ensure the pulley grooves are free of any foreign material (paint, imbedded rubber residue, etc.).
Install a new Poly-V, 10PK (10 rib) belt Navistar part number:

step2.para: Use part number 3501266C1 for 9100, 9200, and 9400 Models.

note.para: Do not deviate from the listed part numbers and ensure the belt is properly positioned in the pulley grooves.

step1.para: Tighten the belt to 350 lbs. tension using a calibrated Kent Moore ZTSE-4416 belt tension gauge or equivalent.
Tighten the 3 fan drive mounting bolts to 110 to 120 ft-lbs. (149 to 169 Nm) and the tension adjustment bolt locknut to 75 to 85 ft-lbs. (102 to 115 Nm).
Start and run the engine at approximately 1000 RPM for a minimum of 5 minutes to allow the Poly-V belt to properly seat in the pulley grooves.
Stop the engine and allow the belt to cool for a minimum of 15 minutes.

note.para: Steps 10 and 11 are crucial for accurate re-tension readings.

step1.para: Recheck belt tension, if less than 240 lbs. reset tension to 240 lbs.
